intro: Arachnothryx lineolata, commonly known as the spotted ash or lineolated ash, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often marked with distinctive spots or lines. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically white or pale yellow in color. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
